New Records: England lost the last game before a full tournament for just the second time in their history, and the first since 1954.
Key Match Events: Jon Thorsteinsson scored the only goal of the match, beating Aaron Ramsdale at the near post.
Harry Kane fired over the bar, Phil Foden slotted an effort wide, and Cole Palmer missed a one-on-one opportunity.
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate named his 26-man squad on Thursday, creating anticipation ahead of the match.
The match was England's final warm-up game ahead of Euro 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate described the performance as 'disjointed and disappointing' and emphasized the need to improve before the tournament.
Declan Rice acknowledged the result as 'not ideal' but highlighted positive performances and learning opportunities.
Anthony Gordon mentioned a 'lack of quality in the final third' and saw the match as good practice for breaking down defensive teams.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match marked a famous Wembley win for Iceland, adding to their notable victory against England at Euro 2016.
